intro: Gymnosteris minuscula, commonly known as the small gymnosteris, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features include a short stem, alternate leaves, and white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
